embeds.title: Tail Whip
embeds.description:
Basic Attack / 2 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 10 (13) damage.
Apply 0 (1) - 2 **Weak** :p_weak:.
Apply 0 (1) - 2 **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: ah yes
drunk uppercut
upgrade at first fire pls
don't put yourself through the pain of needing vuln/weak and not getting it
this, ??? basic, and the nature of ??? cards being extremely unreliable makes snecko in act 1 a pain
Although snecko got a major buff when collector started existing, you are mine is probably your best starter to lock, and I would argue would be better than upgrading this at first campfire

I see what they are going for with unidentified cards, since cross character cards can have absolutely insane synergies, so they wanted to have some way to make it a bit harder to achieve. However the current unid system fails the early to mid game so damn hard.
To actually add cards to your deck you need to use a campfire, which is so extremely janky, and also means your deck doesn't get upgraded as much.

which is also why <unidentified egg> is the strength of a boss relic. Identifying is free so you can actually add cards to your deck and know what they are, and they are also upgraded. This could be split into 2 different relics and I think they'd both be rare and really strong.

embeds.title: Unidentified Egg
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Snecko / Downfall

Identifying becomes a free action.
Unidentified cards in card rewards are **Upgrade**d.
*What will hatch? Pay $1000 to see.*

messages.content: Every character has their aspects of rng, but with snecko it feels impossible to consistently do well because of how bad her early game is.
https://discord.com/channels/669242017427226638/1171177883868344451/1172636543966523473 a new day, a new bracket vote
Tail Whip is meh imo. but I'm not very good at snek

This card is very weak and also unpleasant to use. I remember someone once discussed what if all random ranges were randomized on draw, not on use (like Snecko eye!) and i think that would be a much more fun game mechanic
Your starting source of muddle is a non-free attack and your starting expensive card applies vulnerable but must be played after it. Snecko is an exercise in suffering
Also getting 0 on the status you need sucks
And also muddling it has a chance to backfire
Even if the stats were higher it would still be aggravating to use
i just realized the beta art is a snecko performing a tailwhip on a bike lmao

This is an awful starting card, though somehow still better than both the unidentified starter cards snecko gets. I feel like you basically have to upgrade this at the first campfire to make it even remotely decent, getting a 0 on weak, vulnerable, or both is just miserable for a 2 cost card with low damage. Especially considering how critical landing weak and vulnerable is in the early game against nob and lagavulin. I will say, I understand why this is here. Expensive cards have natural synergies for snecko, so it makes sense to give you one at the start, and muddling this down to 1 or 0 usually feels great, and gives you a reasonable direction to head in from the early game for deckbuilding. I just really dislike the range cards, especially because they are so focused on output variance. I really think they should be removed, or at the very least properly supported or changed to show you what they will do when you draw them. Works better with necronomicon, snecko eye, master eye, and loaded die.

I might be the only tail whip enthusiast here. I think this card is pretty good for snecko! Sure tailwhip sucks WHEN its unupgraded but you should always start every run upgrading this card (ID eruption is a trap don't do it!). Tail whip+ does a slightly below average 13 damage, but it also will always provide at least 1 weak and vulnerable. The best way to play this card is to treat it like an uppercut and expect the debuffs to only last one turn; treating any extra turns as a bonus. Having weak in your starter deck on an attack is vital for letting snecko take on Lagavulin and Gremlin nob; dealing damage and saving HP. The added vurnable can help out with the math sometimes too, especially later on in the run when you got an extra energy and some 0 cost attacks. Tailwhip itself can also become a 0 cost attack pretty easily with sneckos plentiful muddle cards making this card stay relevant for the whole game! I never remove tailwhip. I will remove unid basic and snek bite (which are the acutally awful starter cards) but I've never been in a run where I've wanted to remove this card.

Tailwhip plays an important roll in helping snecko out at the start of the game, its hard to find attacks with this character and having something thats good enough to get you through fights can go a long way in helping you advance through the game. It helps that 2 cost cards a pretty good on snecko too; letting you keep playing tail whip for decent value later on when you can muddle this card. Tailwhip just fits really nicely into sneckos kit, doing a lot better then your other basic cards on average.
ok no one is saying they will get rid of tail whip
fr get rid of <unidentified basic> thats the truly bad starter card for snecko!

which curses is it BETTER than
its better then normality

Pure snecko you might be able to fish for you are mine, which is a MASSIVE high roll if you do. Even though snecko doesn't have the energy for it and you might not get the muddle, it with tail whip (upgraded) can keep the damage around for a while
aged too
for each you are mine you get, theres also a completely dead duelcast (why can you even get duelcast???)
duelcast, the failed head-to-head game console by sega
I'd rather have it over pain/regret, tbh it's probably only worse than a slimed or the ethereal one
in your *dreams*

<snek bite> is also a fraudulent card, its out here muddling one card when snecko has commons that muddle your entire hand for you! You cannot even choose which card snek bite muddles like a true grit

embeds.title: Snek Bite
embeds.description:
Basic Attack / 1 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 7 (9) damage.
**Muddle** the  (2) highest-cost card (cards) in your hand.

messages.content: snek bite is at least a strike that does 1 more damage, which is good for like I think 6 fights and then you want something better
I still think snek bite should let you choose which card to muddle; at least let it have that when its upgraded like true grit
to be fair, i've found that a lot of snecko's cards that affect tons of cards in hand are usually pretty overtuned. the character just needs them to survive lol
iirc stanek was planning to nerf soul roll to 1 card
admittedly, 1 targeted card
there's also rotation and something else
shift?
yeah
Snecko NEEDS some buffs to compensate for that please, character is already weak enough
i already suggested my buffs. ain't gonna happen 🤷
Give it a real basic card that isn't only good because you can't actually add cards to your deck
the unid card rework?
ye
My opinion keeps solidifying that Snecko really needs serious design help and is the part of the whole mod in most need of attention
After Baalorlord streamed a Snecko run yesterday, his first comment was along the lines of "sometimes mod content makes you appreciate the base game more", which, polite, but ouch
there are definitely some characters where I would have to agree
snecko is one of them
snecko is anti fun
all of the other characters have gimmicks that make their cards actually work
like
a starter relic, or a innate gimmick
so champions crown or cracked core
snecko is a little different, thats all there is to discuss
that's what makes dualcast and execute good
the way snecko makes cards playable is not interesting, it's ultimately infinite fishing with cards like soul roll+

there are no cross character synergies, just muddle into infinite while going into pools with strong cards - strike with defect and get meteor strike, dexterity with silent and get wraith form, then abuse it
the amount of runs where you perform novel strategies vs the number of runs where you die or do something stupid are immense
I definitely agree, I hope they have something planned because I know I came up with a rework idea that solved most of the issues I have with snecko, and I believe Evab also did one as well.
Yes, it turns into very unintentional gameplay. Each combat has drastically different cards so you can only rely on stuff when it is muddle to be a 0 cost cantrip
